channel.title: Md. Jehadul Karim (Sabit)
channel.description: Recent content on Md. Jehadul Karim (Sabit)

item.title: AKash
item.description: AKash is a simple Banking Application using Java & JavaFX Dependencies JDK 11+ JAVAFX for Java 9+ How to run? In the release folder, you’ll find Jar Files Edit the script files (.bat for windows/.sh for linux) according to your settings Execute the script files (First Server, then Client) How to use You can use command line of Server to execute ADMIN works

item.title: Corona Update
item.description: An Android App which shows current situation of corona all over the world. It shows, Total Number of Infected People Total Number of Recovered People Total number of Active cases Total number of Death To use the app, you have to be conncted to the Internet. The app gets data from the Internet. To avoid unneccesary complexity, I didn’t add an other facilities like auto refresh. You can refresh manually by closing and opening the app again.

item.title: Messenger
item.description: A Simple Multi-Client Messenger with Java Socket Networking… [ Java Executable Link Given Below ] Just like any other messenger, It has Sign Up and Log in Sorting User Depending on Recent Activity Unread Message Batch Real time message update (with Customizable Frequency 1Hz) Black Theme :3 Screenshots

item.title: Infinite Runner 2D
item.description: Infinite Runner 2D is a 2D game using C Programming Language and iGraphics - An OpenGL Wrapper. The game is about a boy keeps running and running, in his way he faces two types of obsacles. He needs to jump to avoid collisin. He can throw a Kunai to destroy one kind of object. But this throwing comes at a cost, 100 point is deducted each time it is thrown.

item.title: About
item.description: About Me Hi, my name is Md. Jehadul Karim (Sabit). I’m from Dhaka, Bangladesh. I’m an undergraduate student majoring in Computer Science & Engineering at BUET. I started my undergraduate life in April, 2019. I am interested in Game Deveopment, Mobile Application Development & Software Development. I have created some Softwares with my current knowledge. You can find my works here. In my spare time, I like to play Video Games, watching Movies and TV Series.

item.title: Resume
item.description: Md. Jehadul Karim (Sabit) Passionate | Pessimistic | Learner Studying CSE @ BUET Skills Languages: C | Java | SQL Tools: Git Platform: Linux | Android | Windows Specific Skills: C: OpenGL/IGraphics Java: JavaFX SQL: SQLite Git: GitHub Contact GMail | Facebok | GitHub | LinkedIn

item.title: JavaFX Environment Setup
item.description: JavaFX Download JavaFX for 11, not for IntelliJ Bundled JDK Windows and Linux Versions are different, one should not work on another. Unzip JavaFX to your HDD Go to Structure for New Projects Add JavaFX to Global Library Go to Preferences (or File -> Settings) -> Appearance & Behavior -> Path Variables, and define the name of the variable as PATH_TO_FX, and browse to the lib folder of the JavaFX SDK to set its value, and click apply.

item.title: Java Environment Setup
item.description: JDK and JRE Setup JRE not needed for Version > 10 Download Java LTS (Java 8, Java 11, …) Oracle JDK 11 Amazon Correto 11 Zulu (includes JavaFX auto in JDK11) Intellij (>2019.1) comes with bundled JDK which includes JavaFX Java Path Variable Setup Windows Go to “Advanced System Settings”: Go to “Environment Variable” Add New System Variable named “JAVA_HOME” where you have installed your JDK Edit Path in System Variable and add the location where “javac.
